title: Collection Novels
description: Herbert George "H.G." Wells (1866 - 1946) was a prolific English writer in many genres, including the novel, history, politics, and social commentary, and even textbooks and rules for war games. He is now best remembered for his science fiction novels, and Wells is sometimes called the father of science fiction, though the same claim is made for Jules Verne and Hugo Gernsback.His most notable science fiction works include The War of the Worlds, The Time Machine, The Invisible Man, and The Island of Doctor Moreau. In this book: The Time Machine The War of the Worlds The First Men In The Moon The Invisible Man The Island of Doctor Moreau The Red Room The Country of the Blind, And Other Stories The Door in the Wall And Other Stories The World Set Free
author: H.G. Wells
